channel.title: Community Pulse
channel.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
channel.itunes:summary: Community Builders Mary Thengvall, Jason Hand, and PJ Hagerty interview experts in the field of Community Leadership and Management on a broad range of topics related to building community.
channel.description: Community Builders Mary Thengvall, Jason Hand, and PJ Hagerty interview experts in the field of Community Leadership and Management on a broad range of topics related to building community.

item.title: Codes of Conduct - Community Pulse Episode 29
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Jason flies solo on a great discussion of Codes of Conduct for events. We've brought in Carina C. Zona (CallBackWomen), Justin Reese (Code & Supply), and Tessa Mero (Cisco) to talk what works, what doesn't, andwhat happens when the CoC isn't followed.
item.description: Jason flies solo on a great discussion of Codes of Conduct for events. We've brought in Carina C. Zona (CallBackWomen), Justin Reese (Code & Supply), and Tessa Mero (Cisco) to talk what works, what doesn't, andwhat happens when the CoC isn't followed.

item.title: RelationshipsIRL - Community Pulse Episode 28
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Mary opens up to PJ and Jason about struggles to create an in-person personal community when we're so often on the road. Even us extroverts need some downtime from the tech community and a chance to connect with friends, but how do we go about creating deep friendships when we aren't home to invest in them?
item.description: Mary opens up to PJ and Jason about struggles to create an in-person personal community when we're so often on the road. Even us extroverts need some downtime from the tech community and a chance to connect with friends, but how do we go about creating deep friendships when we aren't home to invest in them?

item.title: After Pulse: Content Is Key - Community Pulse Episode 27ap
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Mary, Jason, and PJ get together after [Episode 27: Content is Key](http://communitypulse.io/27-content-is-key/) to talk content, Mary's upcoming book, and some of the hurdles they've seen to getting content out there.
item.description: Mary, Jason, and PJ get together after [Episode 27: Content is Key](http://communitypulse.io/27-content-is-key/) to talk content, Mary's upcoming book, and some of the hurdles they've seen to getting content out there.

item.title: Content Is Key! - Community Pulse Episode 27
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: One important part of the Dev Advocate lifestyle is content creation, This can range from penning the perfect tweet to blog posts to docs and tutorials. Content matters when it comes to interacting with the Community. We’ll talk about content creation and working with folks who are not content creators to make the best of your project or community’s written record.
item.description: One important part of the Dev Advocate lifestyle is content creation, This can range from penning the perfect tweet to blog posts to docs and tutorials. Content matters when it comes to interacting with the Community. We’ll talk about content creation and working with folks who are not content creators to make the best of your project or community’s written record.

item.title: Funemployment & Downtime - Community Pulse Episode 26
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: What happens when you step out of the office and take a break for a while? Whether vacation or funemployment, downtime is important. But how do we do this while continuing to be part of our communities? Jason & PJ chat about these topics & more.
item.description: What happens when you step out of the office and take a break for a while? Whether vacation or funemployment, downtime is important. But how do we do this while continuing to be part of our communities? Jason & PJ chat about these topics & more.

item.title: - Community Pulse Episode 25ap
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: PJ, Jason, and Mary sync up after [Episode 25: Team Dynamics](http://communitypulse.io/25-team-dynamics/) to talk about which teams DevRel does (and doesn’t) fit into, why it’s so important to communicate across teams, and the most important skill: flexibility.
item.description: PJ, Jason, and Mary sync up after [Episode 25: Team Dynamics](http://communitypulse.io/25-team-dynamics/) to talk about which teams DevRel does (and doesn’t) fit into, why it’s so important to communicate across teams, and the most important skill: flexibility.

item.title: Team Dynamics -- Your Team, Other Teams, and the Company 'Team' - Community Pulse Episode 25
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: We sit down with [J. Paul Reed](https://twitter.com/jpreed) and [Greg Bulmash](https://twitter.com/yiddishninja) to chat about team dynamics, working between departments, and setting boundaries for your DevRel team.
item.description: We sit down with [J. Paul Reed](https://twitter.com/jpreed) and [Greg Bulmash](https://twitter.com/yiddishninja) to chat about team dynamics, working between departments, and setting boundaries for your DevRel team.

item.title: After Pulse: Imposter Syndrome - Community Pulse Episode 24ap
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: PJ, Jason, and Mary sync up after the podcast recording with Kelsey Hightower ([Episode 24: Imposter Syndrome](http://communitypulse.io/24-imposter-syndrome/)) to recap the episode and share a few more thoughts about imposter syndrome in the DevRel industry.
item.description: PJ, Jason, and Mary sync up after the podcast recording with Kelsey Hightower ([Episode 24: Imposter Syndrome](http://communitypulse.io/24-imposter-syndrome/)) to recap the episode and share a few more thoughts about imposter syndrome in the DevRel industry.

item.title: Imposter Syndrome - Community Pulse Episode 24
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: PJ, Jason, and Mary joined up with [Kelsey Hightower](https://twitter.com/kelseyhightower) from Google Cloud Platform to chat about imposter syndrome: What is imposter syndrome? Is it actually a thing? How can we overcome imposter syndrome in ourselves? How can we prevent imposter syndrome in others?
item.description: PJ, Jason, and Mary joined up with [Kelsey Hightower](https://twitter.com/kelseyhightower) from Google Cloud Platform to chat about imposter syndrome: What is imposter syndrome? Is it actually a thing? How can we overcome imposter syndrome in ourselves? How can we prevent imposter syndrome in others?

item.title: How to Submit the Best CFP of Your Life (And What to Do When It Gets Accepted) - Community Pulse Episode 23
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Conference season is fast approaching, but we all know that the true preparation starts months before. In this episode of Community Pulse, Mary, PJ, and Jason sit down with Open Source Consultant and author [VM (Vicky) Brasseur](https://twitter.com/vmbrasseur) to chat about how to craft the best CFPs, navigating the land of limbo, and how to prepare the best talk once you've gotten your acceptance notice.
item.description: Conference season is fast approaching, but we all know that the true preparation starts months before. In this episode of Community Pulse, Mary, PJ, and Jason sit down with Open Source Consultant and author [VM (Vicky) Brasseur](https://twitter.com/vmbrasseur) to chat about how to craft the best CFPs, navigating the land of limbo, and how to prepare the best talk once you've gotten your acceptance notice.

item.title: Hiring a DevRel Team: The Who, How, What, and When - Community Pulse Episode 22
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: PJ and Jason sit down with [Matt Broberg](https://twitter.com/mbbroberg), VP of Community at Sensu and [Jill Jubinski](https://twitter.com/jilljubs), ‎Senior Manager of Tech Recruiting at ‎Fastly to talk about hiring a Developer Relations team. From how to find the mythical creatures that form the right team to who your first hire should be, you'll learn about the who, how, what, and when of pulling together a Developer Relations team from scratch.
item.description: PJ and Jason sit down with [Matt Broberg](https://twitter.com/mbbroberg), VP of Community at Sensu and [Jill Jubinski](https://twitter.com/jilljubs), ‎Senior Manager of Tech Recruiting at ‎Fastly to talk about hiring a Developer Relations team. From how to find the mythical creatures that form the right team to who your first hire should be, you'll learn about the who, how, what, and when of pulling together a Developer Relations team from scratch.

item.title: Breaking Into DevRel - Community Pulse Episode 21
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: How do you know what to expect when you transition into Community & DevRel? This month, PJ and Mary chat with [Emily Freeman](https://twitter.com/editingemily) and [Chloe Condon](https://twitter.com/ChloeCondon) about their experience and what they wish they had known.
item.description: How do you know what to expect when you transition into Community & DevRel? This month, PJ and Mary chat with [Emily Freeman](https://twitter.com/editingemily) and [Chloe Condon](https://twitter.com/ChloeCondon) about their experience and what they wish they had known.

item.title: Meetups - Community Pulse Episode 20
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Mary, Jason, and PJ get together to kick off 2018 with a chat about meetups! What makes a great meetup? Are branded meetups valuable? Let's find out.
item.description: Mary, Jason, and PJ get together to kick off 2018 with a chat about meetups! What makes a great meetup? Are branded meetups valuable? Let's find out.

item.title: 2017 in Review - Community Pulse Episode 19
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Jason, Mary, and PJ do an end of year wrap-up on the highs, lows, and day-to-day of 2017. We talk about the tough parts of being in DevRel, the importance of diversity, and other topics we've seen this year.
item.description: Jason, Mary, and PJ do an end of year wrap-up on the highs, lows, and day-to-day of 2017. We talk about the tough parts of being in DevRel, the importance of diversity, and other topics we've seen this year.

item.title: Justin Reese at Uptime Conf - Community Pulse Episode 18
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Episode 18 finds Jason and PJ in Pittsburgh at Uptime Conf! We took the opportunity to sit down with Community Organizer and Pittsburgh Advocate, Justin Reese.
item.description: Episode 18 finds Jason and PJ in Pittsburgh at Uptime Conf! We took the opportunity to sit down with Community Organizer and Pittsburgh Advocate, Justin Reese.

item.title: The Importance of Interaction - Community Pulse Episode 17
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Mary, Jason, and PJ sit down with the illustrious [Anil Dash](https://twitter.com/anildash) of Fog Creek Software to discuss interactions with people, why DevRel is so important yet misunderstood, and Anil's cool new project, [Glitch](https://glitch.com/).
item.description: In this episode, Mary, Jason, and PJ sit down with the illustrious [Anil Dash](https://twitter.com/anildash) of Fog Creek Software to discuss interactions with people, why DevRel is so important yet misunderstood, and Anil's cool new project, [Glitch](https://glitch.com/).

item.title: DevOpsDays and Beyond - Community Pulse Episode 16
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: After all 3 hosts being in the same physical place at the same time, Mary, Jason, and PJ come together to recap DevOpsDays, talk about different communities, and chat about all the things we're thinking.
item.description: After all 3 hosts being in the same physical place at the same time, Mary, Jason, and PJ come together to recap DevOpsDays, talk about different communities, and chat about all the things we're thinking.

item.title: Ignite'ing Your Community - Community Pulse Episode 15
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Jason and Mary chat with some of the top people behind [Ignite Talks](http://ignitetalks.io) about building communities, drawing people together, and how to know when your plans need to pivot.
item.description: Jason and Mary chat with some of the top people behind [Ignite Talks](http://ignitetalks.io) about building communities, drawing people together, and how to know when your plans need to pivot.

item.title: Let's Start at the Very Beginning - Community Pulse Episode 14
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Jason, Mary, and PJ talk to [Kim Bannerman](http://twitter.com/kmbannerman) & [Eamon Leonard](http://twitter.com/eamonleonard) about how to start a community. We also explore who makes up a community, what separates leaders from participants, and more.
item.description: Jason, Mary, and PJ talk to [Kim Bannerman](http://twitter.com/kmbannerman) & [Eamon Leonard](http://twitter.com/eamonleonard) about how to start a community. We also explore who makes up a community, what separates leaders from participants, and more.

item.title: New Year, New Plan - Community Pulse Episode 13
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Mary, Jason, and PJ talk to [Ken Mugrage](http://twitter.com/kmugrage) and [Matthew Broberg](http://twitter.com/mjbrender) about how to plan for a new year. We work through what a retrospective is (and why it might be useful), as well as how to prioritize & measure your work.
item.description: Mary, Jason, and PJ talk to [Ken Mugrage](http://twitter.com/kmugrage) and [Matthew Broberg](http://twitter.com/mjbrender) about how to plan for a new year. We work through what a retrospective is (and why it might be useful), as well as how to prioritize & measure your work.

item.title: Same Job, New City - Community Pulse Episode 12
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Mary and PJ get together with [Jason Yee](http://twitter.com/gitbisect) (at an airport), [Davey Shafik](http://twitter.com/dshafik) (just home from a trip), and [David Blank-Edelman](http://twitter.com/otterbook) (in a hotel room) to talk travel tips, packing ideas, and what you can't live without on a plane.
item.description: Mary and PJ get together with [Jason Yee](http://twitter.com/gitbisect) (at an airport), [Davey Shafik](http://twitter.com/dshafik) (just home from a trip), and [David Blank-Edelman](http://twitter.com/otterbook) (in a hotel room) to talk travel tips, packing ideas, and what you can't live without on a plane.

item.title: Burnout - Part Two - Community Pulse Episode 11
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: [Jessica Fish](https://twitter.com/fishica) and [John Willis](https://twitter.com/botchagalupe) return more discussions around burnout. This time, Jason, Mary, and PJ talk to them about recognizing burnout in both yourself and others, and how to deal with it.
item.description: [Jessica Fish](https://twitter.com/fishica) and [John Willis](https://twitter.com/botchagalupe) return more discussions around burnout. This time, Jason, Mary, and PJ talk to them about recognizing burnout in both yourself and others, and how to deal with it.

item.title: Burnout - Part One - Community Pulse Episode 10
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Hosts Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, and PJ Hagerty talk to guests [Jessica Fish](https://twitter.com/fishica) and [John Willis](https://twitter.com/botchagalupe) about the very real problem of burnout in the DevRel community. In this two part series, we discuss why it's an issue, how to recognize it, and how to prevent it.
item.description: Hosts Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, and PJ Hagerty talk to guests [Jessica Fish](https://twitter.com/fishica) and [John Willis](https://twitter.com/botchagalupe) about the very real problem of burnout in the DevRel community. In this two part series, we discuss why it's an issue, how to recognize it, and how to prevent it.

item.title: Balancing Public & Private Lives - Community Pulse Episode 09
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: In this Halloween-ish episode of Community Pulse, PJ and Mary talk to [Coraline Ada Ehmke](https://twitter.com/CoralineAda) and [Ed Finkler](https://twitter.com/funkatron). We explore the the two sides of the same coin that are the life of technical advocates.
item.description: In this Halloween-ish episode of Community Pulse, PJ and Mary talk to [Coraline Ada Ehmke](https://twitter.com/CoralineAda) and [Ed Finkler](https://twitter.com/funkatron). We explore the the two sides of the same coin that are the life of technical advocates.

item.title: Introducing PJ - Community Pulse Episode 08
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: The one where we introduce [PJ Hagerty](https://twitter.com/aspleenic), the new guy. Jason and Mary talk about why they've decided to add a third person, as well as their plan for the next few episodes and their hopes for the podcast going forward.
item.description: The one where we introduce [PJ Hagerty](https://twitter.com/aspleenic), the new guy. Jason and Mary talk about why they've decided to add a third person, as well as their plan for the next few episodes and their hopes for the podcast going forward.

item.title: Making a Jump From One to Many - Community Pulse Episode 07
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: In this episode of Community Pulse we were joined by [Nathen Harvey](https://twitter.com/nathenharvey) (VP of Community Development, Chef) and [Phil Leggetter](https://twitter.com/leggetter) (Head of Developer Relations, Nexmo) to talk about learning to scale a community role.
item.description: In this episode of Community Pulse we were joined by [Nathen Harvey](https://twitter.com/nathenharvey) (VP of Community Development, Chef) and [Phil Leggetter](https://twitter.com/leggetter) (Head of Developer Relations, Nexmo) to talk about learning to scale a community role.

item.title: #DevRelsFTW - Community Pulse Episode 06
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: [Jason Yee](https://twitter.com/gitbisect), [PJ Hagerty](https://twiter.com/aspleenic), and [Carina C. Zona](https://twitter.com/cczona) join us to talk through some of the prevalent struggles in community management. Trust us -- you'll simply want to listen.
item.description: [Jason Yee](https://twitter.com/gitbisect), [PJ Hagerty](https://twiter.com/aspleenic), and [Carina C. Zona](https://twitter.com/cczona) join us to talk through some of the prevalent struggles in community management. Trust us -- you'll simply want to listen.

item.title: The Community for Community Professionals - Community Pulse Episode 05
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: [CMX](http://cmxhub.com/) is the community for community professionals. We talk to [David Spinks](https://twitter.com/davidspinks) and [Carrie Jones](https://twitter.com/caremjo) about the future of community professionals.
item.description: [CMX](http://cmxhub.com/) is the community for community professionals. We talk to [David Spinks](https://twitter.com/davidspinks) and [Carrie Jones](https://twitter.com/caremjo) about the future of community professionals.

item.title: Metrics: Arch Nemesis of the Community Builder - Community Pulse Episode 04
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Metrics tend to be the community builder's arch nemesis. In this episode, Jason and Mary sit down with community folks from Keen and Bitergia.
item.description: Metrics tend to be the community builder's arch nemesis. In this episode, Jason and Mary sit down with community folks from Keen and Bitergia.

item.title: Andrew Hyde: Pursue Your Passions - Community Pulse Episode 03
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Community builder and organizer [Andrew Hyde](http://twitter.com/andrewhyde) talks about how to pursue your passions in this episode of Community Pulse.
item.description: Community builder and organizer [Andrew Hyde](http://twitter.com/andrewhyde) talks about how to pursue your passions in this episode of Community Pulse.

item.title: Jono Bacon: Father of Community - Community Pulse Episode 02
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Jason and Mary talk to [Jono Bacon](https://twitter.com/jonobacon) about the difference between 'read' and 'write' communities. We also cover how difficult (and important!) it is for us to define our role, how to deal with our harshest critics, and more.
item.description: Jason and Mary talk to [Jono Bacon](https://twitter.com/jonobacon) about the difference between 'read' and 'write' communities. We also cover how difficult (and important!) it is for us to define our role, how to deal with our harshest critics, and more.

item.title: Meet the Hosts - Community Pulse Episode 01
item.itunes:author: Jason Hand, Mary Thengvall, PJ Hagerty
item.itunes:summary: Get to know the hosts of the new Community Pulse podcast: [Jason Hand](http://twitter.com/jasonhand) and [Mary Thengvall](http://twitter.com/mary_grace).
item.description: Get to know the hosts of the new Community Pulse podcast: [Jason Hand](http://twitter.com/jasonhand) and [Mary Thengvall](http://twitter.com/mary_grace).
